00104 const char *lgss_svc_str[LGSS_SVC_MAX] = {
00105         [LGSS_SVC_MGS] = LGSS_SVC_MGS_STR,
00106         [LGSS_SVC_MDS] = LGSS_SVC_MDS_STR,
00107         [LGSS_SVC_OSS] = LGSS_SVC_OSS_STR,
00108 };

00110 /****************************************
00111  * inter-process locking                *
00112  ****************************************/
00113 
00114 static struct lgss_mutex_s {
00115         char           *sem_name;
00116         key_t           sem_key;
00117         int             sem_id;
00118 } lgss_mutexes[LGSS_MUTEX_MAX] = {
00119         [LGSS_MUTEX_KRB5]       = { "keyring",  0x4292d473, 0 },
00120 };
00121 
00122 static int lgss_mutex_get(struct lgss_mutex_s *mutex)
00123 {
00124         mutex->sem_id = semget(mutex->sem_key, 1, IPC_CREAT | IPC_EXCL | 0700);
00125         if (mutex->sem_id != -1) {
00126                 if (semctl(mutex->sem_id, 0, SETVAL, 1) == -1) {
00127                         logmsg(LL_ERR, "initialize sem %x: %s\n",
00128                                mutex->sem_key, strerror(errno));
00129                         return -1;
00130                 }
00131 
00132                 logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "created & initialized sem %x id %d for %s\n",
00133                        mutex->sem_key, mutex->sem_id, mutex->sem_name);
00134         } else {
00135                 if (errno != EEXIST) {
00136                         logmsg(LL_ERR, "create sem %x: %s\n",
00137                                mutex->sem_key, strerror(errno));
00138                         return -1;
00139                 }
00140 
00141                 /* already created by someone else, simply get it.
00142                  * Note there's still a small window of racing between create
00143                  * and initialize, a flaw in semaphore semantics */
00144                 mutex->sem_id = semget(mutex->sem_key, 0, 0700);
00145                 if (mutex->sem_id == -1) {
00146                         if (errno == ENOENT) {
00147                                 logmsg(LL_WARN, "sem %x just disappeared "
00148                                        "under us, try again\n", mutex->sem_key);
00149                                 return 1;
00150                         }
00151 
00152                         logmsg(LL_ERR, "get sem %x: %s\n", mutex->sem_key,
00153                                strerror(errno));
00154                         return -1;
00155                 }
00156 
00157                 logmsg(LL_TRACE, "got sem %x id %d for %s\n",
00158                        mutex->sem_key, mutex->sem_id, mutex->sem_name);
00159         }
00160 
00161         return 0;
00162 }
00163 
00164 int lgss_mutex_lock(lgss_mutex_id_t mid)
00165 {
00166         struct lgss_mutex_s     *sem = &lgss_mutexes[mid];
00167         struct sembuf            sembuf;
00168         int                      rc;
00169 
00170         lassert(mid < LGSS_MUTEX_MAX);
00171 
00172         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "locking mutex %x for %s\n",
00173                sem->sem_key, sem->sem_name);
00174 
00175         do {
00176                 rc = lgss_mutex_get(sem);
00177                 if (rc < 0)
00178                         return rc;
00179         } while (rc);
00180 
00181         sembuf.sem_num = 0;
00182         sembuf.sem_op = -1;
00183         sembuf.sem_flg = SEM_UNDO;
00184 
00185         if (semop(sem->sem_id, &sembuf, 1) != 0) {
00186                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "lock mutex %x: %s\n", sem->sem_key,
00187                        strerror(errno));
00188                 return -1;
00189         }
00190 
00191         logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "locked mutex %x for %s\n",
00192                sem->sem_key, sem->sem_name);
00193         return 0;
00194 }
00195 
00196 int lgss_mutex_unlock(lgss_mutex_id_t mid)
00197 {
00198         struct lgss_mutex_s     *sem = &lgss_mutexes[mid];
00199         struct sembuf            sembuf;
00200 
00201         lassert(mid < LGSS_MUTEX_MAX);
00202         lassert(sem->sem_id >= 0);
00203 
00204         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "unlocking mutex %x for %s\n",
00205                sem->sem_key, sem->sem_name);
00206 
00207         sembuf.sem_num = 0;
00208         sembuf.sem_op = 1;
00209         sembuf.sem_flg = SEM_UNDO;
00210 
00211         if (semop(sem->sem_id, &sembuf, 1) != 0) {
00212                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "unlock mutex %x: %s\n", sem->sem_key,
00213                        strerror(errno));
00214                 return -1;
00215         }
00216 
00217         logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "unlocked mutex %x for %s\n",
00218                sem->sem_key, sem->sem_name);
00219         return 0;
00220 }

00222 /****************************************

00226 /* from kerberos source, gssapi_krb5.c */
00227 gss_OID_desc krb5oid =
00228         {9, "\052\206\110\206\367\022\001\002\002"};
00229 
00230 gss_OID_desc spkm3oid =
00231         {7, "\053\006\001\005\005\001\003"};

00233 /****************************************
00234  * log facilities                       *
00235  ****************************************/
00236 
00237 loglevel_t g_log_level = LL_WARN;
00238 
00239 static const char *log_prefix[] = {
00240         [LL_ERR]        = "ERROR",
00241         [LL_WARN]       = "WARNING",
00242         [LL_INFO]       = "INFO",
00243         [LL_DEBUG]      = "DEBUG",
00244         [LL_TRACE]      = "TRACE",
00245 };
00246 
00247 void lgss_set_loglevel(loglevel_t level)
00248 {
00249         lassert(level < LL_MAX);
00250         g_log_level = level;
00251 }
00252 
00253 void __logmsg(loglevel_t level, const char *func, const char *format, ...)
00254 {
00255         va_list         ap;
00256         int             offset;
00257         char            buf[1024];
00258 
00259         offset = snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "[%d]:%s:%s(): ",
00260                           getpid(), log_prefix[level], func);
00261 
00262         va_start(ap, format);
00263         vsnprintf(buf + offset, sizeof(buf) - offset, format, ap);
00264         va_end(ap);
00265 
00266         syslog(LOG_INFO, "%s", buf);
00267 }
00268 
00269 void __logmsg_gss(loglevel_t level, const char *func, const gss_OID mech,
00270                   uint32_t major, uint32_t minor, const char *format, ...)
00271 {
00272         va_list         ap;
00273         u_int32_t       maj_stat1, min_stat1;
00274         u_int32_t       maj_stat2, min_stat2;
00275         gss_buffer_desc maj_gss_buf = GSS_C_EMPTY_BUFFER;
00276         gss_buffer_desc min_gss_buf = GSS_C_EMPTY_BUFFER;
00277         char            buf[1024];
00278         char            maj_buf[30], min_buf[30];
00279         char           *maj_msg, *min_msg;
00280         int             offset;
00281         uint32_t        msg_ctx = 0;
00282 
00283         /* Get major status message */
00284         maj_stat1 = gss_display_status(&min_stat1, major, GSS_C_GSS_CODE,
00285                                        mech, &msg_ctx, &maj_gss_buf);
00286         if (maj_stat1 != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
00287                 snprintf(maj_buf, sizeof(maj_buf), "(0x%08x)", major);
00288                 maj_msg = &maj_buf[0];
00289         } else {
00290                 maj_msg = maj_gss_buf.value;
00291         }
00292 
00293         /* Get minor status message */
00294         maj_stat2 = gss_display_status(&min_stat2, minor, GSS_C_MECH_CODE,
00295                                        mech, &msg_ctx, &min_gss_buf);
00296         if (maj_stat2 != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
00297                 snprintf(min_buf, sizeof(min_buf), "(0x%08x)", minor);
00298                 min_msg = &min_buf[0];
00299         } else {
00300                 min_msg = min_gss_buf.value;
00301         }
00302 
00303         /* arrange & log message */
00304         offset = snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "[%d]:%s:%s(): ",
00305                           getpid(), log_prefix[level], func);
00306 
00307         va_start(ap, format);
00308         offset += vsnprintf(buf + offset, sizeof(buf) - offset, format, ap);
00309         va_end(ap);
00310 
00311         snprintf(buf + offset, sizeof(buf) - offset, ": GSSAPI: %s - %s\n",
00312                  maj_msg, min_msg);
00313 
00314         syslog(LOG_INFO, "%s", buf);
00315 
00316         /* release buffers */
00317         if (maj_gss_buf.length != 0)
00318                 gss_release_buffer(&min_stat1, &maj_gss_buf);
00319         if (min_gss_buf.length != 0)
00320                 gss_release_buffer(&min_stat2, &min_gss_buf);
00321 }
00322 
00323 /****************************************
00324  * client credentials                   *
00325  ****************************************/
00326 
00327 struct lgss_mech_type *lgss_name2mech(const char *mech_name)
00328 {
00329         if (strcmp(mech_name, "krb5") == 0)
00330                 return &lgss_mech_krb5;
00331         return NULL;
00332 }
00333 
00334 int lgss_mech_initialize(struct lgss_mech_type *mech)
00335 {
00336         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "initialize mech %s\n", mech->lmt_name);
00337         if (mech->lmt_init)
00338                 return mech->lmt_init();
00339         return 0;
00340 }
00341 
00342 void lgss_mech_finalize(struct lgss_mech_type *mech)
00343 {
00344         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "finalize mech %s\n", mech->lmt_name);
00345         if (mech->lmt_fini)
00346                 mech->lmt_fini();
00347 }
00348 
00349 struct lgss_cred * lgss_create_cred(struct lgss_mech_type *mech)
00350 {
00351         struct lgss_cred       *cred;
00352 
00353         cred = malloc(sizeof(*cred));
00354         if (cred) {
00355                 memset(cred, 0, sizeof(*cred));
00356                 cred->lc_mech = mech;
00357         }
00358 
00359         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "create a %s cred at %p\n", mech->lmt_name, cred);
00360         return cred;
00361 }
00362 
00363 void lgss_destroy_cred(struct lgss_cred *cred)
00364 {
00365         lassert(cred->lc_mech);
00366         lassert(cred->lc_mech_cred == NULL);
00367 
00368         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "destroying a %s cred at %p\n",
00369                cred->lc_mech->lmt_name, cred);
00370         free(cred);
00371 }
00372 
00373 int lgss_prepare_cred(struct lgss_cred *cred)
00374 {
00375         struct lgss_mech_type   *mech = cred->lc_mech;
00376 
00377         lassert(mech);
00378 
00379         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "preparing %s cred %p\n", mech->lmt_name, cred);
00380 
00381         if (mech->lmt_prepare_cred)
00382                 return mech->lmt_prepare_cred(cred);
00383         return 0;
00384 }
00385 
00386 void lgss_release_cred(struct lgss_cred *cred)
00387 {
00388         struct lgss_mech_type   *mech = cred->lc_mech;
00389 
00390         lassert(mech);
00391 
00392         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "releasing %s cred %p\n", mech->lmt_name, cred);
00393 
00394         if (cred->lc_mech_cred) {
00395                 lassert(cred->lc_mech != NULL);
00396                 lassert(cred->lc_mech->lmt_release_cred);
00397 
00398                 cred->lc_mech->lmt_release_cred(cred);
00399         }
00400 }
00401 
00402 int lgss_using_cred(struct lgss_cred *cred)
00403 {
00404         struct lgss_mech_type   *mech = cred->lc_mech;
00405 
00406         lassert(mech);
00407 
00408         logmsg(LL_TRACE, "using %s cred %p\n", mech->lmt_name, cred);
00409 
00410         if (mech->lmt_using_cred)
00411                 return mech->lmt_using_cred(cred);
00412         return 0;
00413 }

00415 /****************************************
00416  * helper functions                     *
00417  ****************************************/
00418 
00419 int lgss_get_service_str(char **string, uint32_t lsvc, uint64_t tgt_nid)
00420 {
00421         const int       max_namelen = 512;
00422         char            namebuf[max_namelen];
00423         int             alloc_size;
00424 
00425         lassert(*string == NULL);
00426 
00427         if (lsvc >= LGSS_SVC_MAX) {
00428                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "invalid lgss service %d\n", lsvc);
00429                 return -1;
00430         }
00431 
00432         if (lnet_nid2hostname(tgt_nid, namebuf, max_namelen)) {
00433                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "cannot resolve hostname from nid %"PRIx64"\n",
00434                        tgt_nid);
00435                 return -1;
00436         }
00437 
00438         alloc_size = 32 + strlen(namebuf);
00439 
00440         *string = malloc(alloc_size);
00441         if (*string == NULL) {
00442                 logmsg(LL_ERR, "can't malloc %d bytes\n", alloc_size);
00443                 return 1;
00444         }
00445 
00446         snprintf(*string, alloc_size, "%s@%s",
00447                  lgss_svc_str[lsvc], namebuf);
00448 
00449         logmsg(LL_DEBUG, "constructed service string: %s\n", *string);
00450         return 0;
00451 }
